crusader.title: Crusader
crusader.name: Reynauld
crusader.summary: Once a simple farmer who joined the war to save his family from famine, Reynauld rose unexpectedly through martial prowess to become a legendary commander. The horrors he witnessed and his own transformation into a hardened warrior left him unable to return to his former life. His peculiar habit of collecting trinkets from fallen enemies and his distinctive whistling became well-known among his men. Now drawn to the Estate, he seeks not holy war but a deeper purpose in combating forces that threaten the very fabric of humanity.
crusader.history: Born to till the soil, Reynauld lived a peaceful life with his wife and young son until famine threatened their survival. He joined the army as a conscript, leaving behind promises of return. His natural leadership and battlefield courage saw him rise from farmer to feared commander. In a pivotal moment, he spared The Warlord, recognizing the futility of endless conflict. This act, coupled with his growing disillusionment, led him to abandon both the war and thoughts of returning home, knowing he could no longer fit into that simple life.

status.description: Recovering from betrayed trust while seeking to rebuild bridges

clothing.head: Steel helm
clothing.accessories: Purple tunic with a white cross

crusader.magic: The light, a divine power that lets him smite foes and heal allies
notes: Has kleptomanic tendencies that he tries to hide
Does a characteristic whistle after nabbing something, or when otherwise pleased with himself
Sometimes writes letters to his family that he never sends
Wears simple farmer's clothes when out of his armor
Carries small trinkets from his past as physical reminders of his failures and those he couldn't save
Struggles with nightmares that require medicinal relief
Carries a pouch of trinkets from his campaigns as physical reminders of his failures

heiress.description: The crusader maintains a professional relationship with the heiress, focusing on fulfilling his role as her protector with a devout sense of duty.

kheir.description: Offered forgiveness despite the betrayal, establishing boundaries while allowing for redemption.

highwayman.description: Defended Dismas by revealing his own collection of mementos, deepening their bond through shared understanding of carrying physical reminders of the past.

seraph.description: The Crusader served under the Seraph after her miraculous transformation, awed by her divine presence and inspired by her holy purpose. Her burned visage and manifest powers were proof of the Light's grace, making his role in her crusade feel truly righteous.

highwayman.title: Highwayman
highwayman.name: Dismas
highwayman.summary: Once a prisoner, the Highwayman is now a haunted fugitive, living off the squalor of the city's canals and the meager pickings from vermin. His vision of freedom has been replaced by a reality of degradation, driving him to reluctantly offer his services for a final, desperate heist. Now, his path has unexpectedly converged with that of the Heiress and the Heir, offering a precarious chance at redemption through service.
highwayman.history: The Highwayman's tale is one of escape and survival, painted with strokes of desperation and grim resolve. Escaping from incarceration during a prison riot, he sought refuge in the underbelly of the city, subsisting in conditions that stripped away his illusions of freedom. A final job, taken out of sheer necessity, ended in tragedy, leaving him with a burden of guilt that no distance can alleviate.

status.description: Bitter about false accusations and increasingly distrustful
wounds: Bruised jaw and torn shoulder from confrontation with townsfolk

clothing.head: Red scarf
clothing.body: Rugged grey coat with fur collar

notes: Has a gallows sense of humor
Subject of rumors and distrust in the hamlet regarding alleged theft of provisions

heiress.description: Feels unfairly judged by Persephone, seeing her as someone who cannot understand the choices made by those less fortunate.

kheir.description: Refuses to accept apologies, believing some bridges burn too hot to cross again.

crusader.description: Recognizes their shared struggles with personal demons, strengthening their bond through mutual understanding.

heiress.title: Heiress
heiress.name: Persephone
heiress.summary: The Heiress to the accursed Estate, excels at taking command in even the most daunting situations. With her sharp intellect and strategic prowess, she fearlessly leads the charge to reclaim her ancestral home while deftly managing the nearby hamlet. Her natural authority and decisive leadership serve as a beacon of strength for a community besieged by supernatural horrors. Though grateful for allies brave enough to join her cause, Persephone's unwavering confidence in her own judgment can manifest as stubborn resistance when her authority is challenged.
heiress.history: Upon receiving a chilling letter from her late ancestor, the Heiress left her academic pursuits with her brother in tow to take up her role as the Heiress of the Estate. She found herself thrust into a nightmarish reality where her ancestral home was not only physically deteriorated but also infested with the horrors summoned by her ancestor's dark rituals.

status.description: In good health and high spirits

appearance.hairStyle: Tied up in a bun and with curly bangs

clothing.head: Hair needle
clothing.body: Marine blue robe over white shirt

notes: Turns to wine when overwhelmed by the stress of managing the Hamlet
Attracted to women with ample breasts

kheir.description: Maintains familial loyalty while strictly holding her brother accountable for his breach of trust.

crusader.description: Demonstrated respect for Reynauld's privacy and supported his dignified response to betrayal.

highwayman.description: Defended Dismas against false accusations, showing that despite her caution, she values truth and fairness.

hqclaimants.description: The Heiress saw the Claimants as vain and insufferable during their fleeting courtly encounters. Their thinly veiled insults ensured no love was lost between them.

duchess.description: The Heiress remembers the Duchess as aloof and self-absorbed during the few balls they attended together. Though she barely knew her, the Duchess's pride left a sour impression.

kheir.title: Heir
kheir.name: Percival
kheir.summary: The Heir to the estate is a brilliant scholar and capable manager who is desperately trying to cope in this world of horrors far beyond his comfort. Despite being a man of cowardice and meek nature, Percival's keen intellect and organizational skills prove invaluable in coordinating the chaotic efforts to reclaim his ancestral home.
kheir.history: Raised in academic circles far from the estate's dark legacy, Percival was reluctantly drawn into the family's quest by his sister. Despite his initial hesitation, he's found ways to apply his scholarly knowledge and managerial expertise to the daunting task at hand.

status.description: Deeply ashamed of his actions and desperate to make amends

notes: Hates waste and is very possesive of his belongings
Has a penchant for fine wines to calm his nerves

heiress.description: Ashamed of disappointing his sister by betraying confidential information and causing unnecessary conflict.

crusader.description: Deeply ashamed of betraying Reynauld's confidence, now committed to earning back trust through actions rather than words.

highwayman.description: Frustrated by Dismas's refusal to accept apologies, yet understanding of the damage his false accusations caused.

hqclaimants.description: The Claimants' constant disdain and biting remarks left a lasting impression on the Heir during the balls and duels of their youth. He remains embittered but grudgingly acknowledges The Claimant brother's skill with a spear.

duchess.description: As a young man, the Heir was captivated by the Duchess' elegance and fencing prowess. Though their interactions were brief and unreciprocated, her image lingered in his mind for years.

crusader.entry: Confronted the public revelation of his past with quiet dignity, choosing forgiveness over vengeance.

highwayman.entry: Withdrew further after being falsely accused, reinforcing his reluctance to fully integrate with the group.

kheir.entry: Publicly apologized for violating trust and weaponizing private information.

heiress.entry: Demonstrated firm leadership by holding her brother accountable while facilitating reconciliation.
